column2: b'MAY I HAVE A WORD WITH "U"?'

column31: b'(Jon of the Clue Crew holds a white rock at White Sands National Monument, New Mexico.) Because it\'s water-soluble, this form of calcium sulfate is rarely found in sand, but here in New Mexico\'s Tularosa Basin, there are no rivers to carry it away, so it forms the famed white sand'
